CatDescriptText: Mr. Samuel Whitehead, 2530 Wadsworth Street, and Mr. Douglas D. Coleman, 131 Wooster Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1958, pg. 3 "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?" Mr. Samuel Whitehead's answer reads: "No, we are not getting a fair deal. I go to different jobs everyday since I finished at Dravo's, and I haven't got a job yet.  contractors are hiring young whites who know nothing about construction work and don't belong to a union."  Mr. Douglas D. Coleman's answer reads: "I don't think so.  I have worked, at the most, about three months out of a year."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Samuel Whitehead wearing suspenders, and Douglas D. Coleman wearing dot patterned shirt, standing n front of car with barber shop in background
